data.title: Universum Media Inc.
data.text:
Scott MacLean

Scott started his career as a camera operator and moved his way through all aspects of the video broadcast industry. He worked for several years as a freelancer for major networks including CTV, TSN, BBC and Global. Scott then accepted a full-time position with the PEI Government’s Multimedia Services Unit and later went to CBC. Over the years, Scott pursued training through the Ryerson Polytechnic University School of Radio & Television Arts, the Canadian Screen Training Centre’s Summer Institute of Film & Television, AVID editing, and later with the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation’s On Course. Following his training, he began to work more with editing, producing, and directing. Scott discovered his strength is directing live events. Motivated to be self-employed and take on the lead role in new projects, Scott founded Universum Media Inc in 2004. Now, he continues to innovate and create with Universum Media Inc. and possesses over 30 years of experience in the industry.

Ed Milliken

Ed has over 35 years of experience as an accomplished broadcast producer. Starting out young, Ed has managed to work his way up the ladder to work highly regarded events. He has experience from many major sporting events, including multiple Olympic Games, years of NHL games, years of motorsport events, and even a variety of documentaries and special events! He is the winner of four 4 NATAS Emmy Awards for Best Live Sporting Event, as well as two Gemini Awards for Best Live Sports Programme and Best Sports Feature. Ed uses his skills and years of experience to help Universum Media Inc. be the best live production company in all of Atlantic Canada.

Tobin Munro

As a graduate of Canadore College’s Broadcasting – Television and Video Production program, Tobin began his broadcasting career with Rogers Community Television in Barrie, Ontario. There he was a production assistant/videographer. During his time with Rogers, he technical directed local daily newscasts, major junior hockey and provincial sporting events. He then joined Woodbine Entertainment Group as a broadcast operator, eventually working his way up to Manager of Broadcast Technology. Over his 20+ years in broadcasting Tobin has worked on numerous productions airing on TSN, Sportsnet, theScore and CTV. Most notably Tobin had served as technical producer on national coverage of some of Canada’s largest horse races since 2018.
